data.title: ADB's $50-mn loan to support policy reform to boost trade in Cambodia - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: The Asian Development Bank recently approved a $50-million policy-based loan to support Cambodia's efforts to make its business environment more investment-friendly, upgrade businesses towards higher competitiveness and ease trade barriers.

data.title: China-Cambodia trade in Jan-Oct 2024 worth $14.4 bn; up 19% YoY - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Imports from Cambodia to China grew by 20 per cent YoY and Chinese enterprises signed investment agreements in Cambodia worth nearly $3 billion during the period.

data.title: New transmission lines cut a Cambodian rainforest sanctuary in half - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Satellite imagery, drone photography and testimony from residents indicate that work has begun on electricity transmission lines that will cut through the heart of Prey Lang Wildlife Sanctuary in order to connect Cambodia’s energy grid with that of Laos.

data.title: Veteran Cambodian Former Foreign Minister Sokhonn Set To Return To His Post - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Prime Minister Hun Manet reappointed veteran politician Prak Sokhonn as the new Minister of Foreign Affairs to steer Cambodia’s foreign policy, reported Fresh News.

data.title: Cross-border travel: Thailand and Cambodia relaunch bus services - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: For the first time since the Covid-19 pandemic hit the brakes, Thailand and Cambodia are set to resume their cross-border bus services.

data.title: An Outpost in Cambodia Isn’t a Game-Changer for China’s Navy - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Cambodia insists Ream is not a Chinese overseas base, pointing to its constitutional prohibition on the permanent stationing of foreign troops in the country to back up its claim.

data.title: Survivors, sniffing dogs join anti-mine march at Cambodia's Angkor Wat - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Survivors and sniffing dogs joined hundreds of people at Cambodia's Angkor Wat on Sunday for a march against landmines after the US decision to send anti-personnel mines to Ukraine.
